label: 上国
対訳語: superior province -Second of the four grades of provinces (kuni) divided according to their population and importance.
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: The superior provinces were Yamashiro-, Settsu-, Owari-, Mikawa-, Tōtōmi-, Suruga-, Kai-, Sagami-, Mino-, Shinano-, Shimotsuke-, Dewa-, Kaga-, Etchū-, Echigo-, Tamba-, Tajima-, Inaba-, Hōki-, Izumo-, Mimasaka-, Bizen-, Bitchū-, Bingo-, Aki-, Suō-, Kii-, Awa- [ in Shikoku ], Sanuki-, Iyo-, Chikuzen-, Chikugo-, Buzen-, Bungo-, and Hizen-no-kuni. [山城、摂津、尾張、三河、遠江、駿河、甲斐、相模、美濃、信濃、下野、出羽、加賀、越中、越後、丹波、但馬、因幡、伯耆、出雲、美作、備前、備中、備後、安芸、周防、紀伊、阿波、四国、讃岐、伊予、筑前、筑後、豊前、豊後、肥前国]
